src:
Previa del partido: el Conil recibe al Sevilla C
02 Nov 2019, 16:02 by SPORT.es

Los equipos lucharán por la victoria el próximo domingo a las 17:00 en el Campo Municipal Jose António Pérez Úreba

El próximo domingo a las 17:00 se enfrentarán en el Campo Municipal Jose António Pérez Úreba el Conil y el Sevilla en el partido que corresponde a la jornada número 12 de la Tercera División.
El Conil llega al duodécimo encuentro con la intención de mejorar sus números en el torneo tras haber empatado 1-1 ante el Arcos en su último partido. Desde el inicio de liga, los locales han vencido en dos de los 11 partidos jugados hasta la fecha, con ocho tantos a favor y 13 en contra.
En el lado de los visitantes, el Sevilla C logró un empate a cero frente al Ceuta, sumando un punto en el último partido disputado de la competición, por lo que intentará seguir sumando puntos a su casillero frente al Conil. Hasta la fecha, de los 11 partidos que ha jugado el Sevilla C en la Tercera División, ha ganado en cuatro de ellos con un balance de 10 goles a favor y ocho en contra.
Como local, el Conil ha vencido una vez, ha sido derrotado en una ocasión y ha empatado tres veces en cinco partidos jugados hasta ahora, unos valores que pueden resultar esperanzadores para el Sevilla C, pues muestran cierta debilidad de los locales en los encuentros que tienen lugar en el Campo Municipal Jose António Pérez Úreba. En las salidas, el Sevilla C ha perdido en dos ocasiones y ha empatado dos veces en sus cinco encuentros que ha jugado hasta ahora, por lo que deberá esforzarse en arañar puntos en su visita al estadio del Conil para intentar romper las estadísticas.
En cuanto a las estadísticas entre los dos contendientes en este estadio en la Tercera División, vemos que el Conil ha ganado cuatro veces al Sevilla, mientras que éste lo ha hecho en dos ocasiones. Asimismo, los locales son los que más veces han ganado en su estadio frente al Sevilla, pues lo han hecho en las cuatro últimas ocasiones. El último enfrentamiento en esta competición entre ambos equipos se jugó en febrero de 2019 y terminó con un marcador de 2-0 para los visitantes.
Con respecto a la situación de ambos equipos en la tabla clasificatoria de la Tercera División, podemos ver que ambos equipos están separados por siete puntos a favor del Sevilla C. El Conil llega al encuentro con 10 puntos en su casillero y ocupando la decimoquinta plaza antes del partido. Por su parte, el equipo visitante cuenta con 17 puntos y ocupa el noveno puesto en la competición.
text:
Indonesia Promotes Tourism to Sweden
02 Nov 2019, 16:43 by Retno M



Indonesia Promotes Tourism to Sweden



Indonesia Promotes Tourism to Sweden



Indonesia Promotes Tourism to Sweden


KBRN, Stockholm: Swedish people have a hobby to travel long distances on average twice a year. Especially to the tourist destinations that offer panoramic attractions of the coast, mountains, and interesting culture. This passion has become one of the opportunities and potentials that must be exploited by Indonesia, to increase the influx of Swedish tourists into Indonesia.
Utilizing this opportunity, as in a written statement received by the RRI editorial, Saturday (3/11/2019), mentioned on 31 October 2019 in Gothenburg, Sweden, the Indonesian embassy (KBRI) Stockholm, in collaboration with Caraka Travelindo, Asien Paradisresor, Nusa Southeast East Destination Management Center (NTT DMC) and supported by Turkish Airlines, organizes a Business to Business Meeting and Workshop with Swedish Travel Agents and Tour Operators to promote attractive and potential tourist attractions marketed for Swedish tourists.
Indonesia's Ambassador to Sweden, Bagas Hapsoro, said that tourism is an increasingly important foreign exchange earner and its contribution to the Indonesian economy is projected to reach USD 24 billion in 2019 beyond the oil and gas sector. Besides that, tourism also creates jobs for local residents and supports the development and development of the region.
This time Ambassador Bagas Hapsoro underlined that Indonesia has a focus on developing sustainable tourism, where tourists not only travel and enjoy a tourist destination, but also engage in beneficial activities that have a deeper meaning to make a major contribution and positive impacts on the preservation of nature, the environment and local communities. The Ambassador invited Swedish tourism stakeholders to work together and promote sustainable Indonesia. Indonesia re-emphasized in addition to offering natural beauty and cultural richness and hospitality, as well as the ease of visa-free 30-day greetings for Swedish tourists, as well as comfortable air throughout the year.
Sigi Neuhaus, a German national who has a great love for Indonesia, through the travel agent company he manages, Caraka Travelindo, intensively promotes Indonesia in his presentation. At present there are 10 new destinations in Indonesia, known as 10 new Bali, and each has its own uniqueness and beauty. Indonesia also has an advanced tourism infrastructure at present and adequate accommodation and transportation facilities that make it easier for tourists who want to vacation in Indonesia.
Some of Indonesia's new tourism destinations, namely Flores, Sumbawa, Komodo Island, Labuan Bajo, were also promoted by Oyan Kristian from NTT DMC. He also added that currently the development of tourism infrastructure in the region is growing rapidly, which is marked by the rise of investors who are building hotel facilities, boat transportation, to facilitate tourists on vacation and enjoy the beauty of the tourist area.
At present there is also a trend for sustainable tourism. Swedish society has a big enough desire to follow tour packages with that theme. This was revealed by Hanna Anfelter, a travel journalist who has great attention to the issue of sustainable tourism. Hanna shared her experience during a tour in the Sidemen area, Bali where tourists can stay in lodging managed by local people and local restaurants provide food from a self-managed garden. There is no use of plastic in the Sidemen area lodging area and prioritizes the concept of back to nature.
The B to B meeting took place intensively and there was an interesting discussion between Swedish and Indonesian Travel Agents, which discussed opportunities for developing new destination tourism packages and Bali which is still the main destination for Swedish tourist visits.
Swedish tourist visits to Indonesia show a relatively increasing trend from year to year. Based on data from the Ministry of Tourism in 2018 there were 50,380 Swedish tourists visiting Indonesia, with an average expenditure of US $ 1,500 per tourist. This value still has considerable potential in the future to increase and needs to be utilized optimally by tourism businesses in Indonesia.
